Trees would form complex social structures, with some serving as leaders or guardians. They might communicate with each other using a yet-to-be-discovered method of tree communication.
Trees would have the ability to defend themselves against predators, such as insects or animals. They could release chemicals to deter or repel attackers.
Trees would have the ability to regulate their own temperature, which could impact their growth and reproduction patterns.
Trees would have the ability to travel long distances in search of mates, leading to the formation of new forests in previously uninhabited areas.
Trees would be able to adapt to changing environments, such as shifting climate patterns, by moving to new locations with more favorable conditions.
